meanings.definition: A person or thing that is strong or sturdy.
meanings.sent1: The old oak tree in the yard is a stourie, standing tall and firm.
meanings.sent2: The castle walls were built to be stourie and withstand any attack.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel thought he was a stourie, trying to lift the acorn twice his size.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve was as stourie as a mountain, unwavering in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The stourie ship sailed through the stormy seas without faltering.

meanings.sent1: The children's laughter caused a stourie in the quiet library.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected arrival of the circus created a stourie in the town square.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy made a stourie by knocking over the flower pots.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm outside added to the stourie of the already chaotic party.
meanings.sent5: The stourie of the market place was overwhelming for the newcomer.

meanings.definition: To make a commotion or disturbance.
meanings.sent1: The children love to stourie around the house on lazy weekends.
meanings.sent2: Please don't stourie in the classroom; we need to focus on our work.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seem to stourie early in the morning, waking everyone up.
meanings.sent4: The protesters planned to stourie outside the government building to demand change.
meanings.sent5: The wind began to stourie through the trees, rustling the leaves loudly.
